articles.author: Andrew MacAskill
articles.title: Exclusive: Britain extends lead as king of currencies despite Brexit vote
articles.description: Britain has extended its lead in the global currency trading business in the two years since it voted to leave the European Union, in another sign London is likely to continue to be one of the world's top two financial centers even after Brexit.

articles.author: Gabriela Baczynska
articles.title: EU expects delay in Brexit deal beyond October target
articles.description: European Union leaders are likely to have to hold an emergency summit in November to consider any Brexit agreement struck with Britain, missing an informal deadline the previous month, diplomats in Brussels said.

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.title: Trump's Fed attack sees dollar dive and emerging markets rally
articles.description: Critical comments by U.S. President Donald Trump about the country's central bank saw the dollar fall for the fourth straight day in its worst spell since March, boosting emerging market stocks and currencies in the process.

articles.author: Melanie Burton
articles.title: BHP annual profit jumps 33 percent, pays record final dividend
articles.description: Global miner BHP posted a 33 percent jump in annual underlying profit on Tuesday on robust oil and copper prices and paid a record final dividend, although it pushed out the timing for some future cost savings.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Beijing to act against 'hidden' local debt: China Daily
articles.description: China has drawn up new guidelines on measuring and controlling "hidden" local government debt, the official China Daily said on Tuesday, citing senior government sources.

articles.author: Renita D. Young
articles.title: PRECIOUS-Gold hits 1-week high as Trump's Fed criticism weighs on dollar
articles.description: Gold steadied after touching a one-week high on Tuesday as the dollar weakened after U.S President Donald Trump criticised the Federal Reserve for raising interest rates.

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: Fed's solo act faces tremors in Turkey and a slower Europe
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, deep into a cycle of rate hikes it hopes to continue into 2020, now faces emerging risks from abroad that could short-circuit its plans.

articles.author: Howard Schneider and Ann Saphir
articles.title: Fed's solo act faces tremors in Turkey and a slower Europe
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, deep into a cycle of rate hikes it hopes to continue into 2020, now faces emerging risks from abroad that could short-circuit its plans.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Singapore's architectural history under threat from redevelopment frenzy
articles.description: A rush to tear down and redevelop buildings in Singapore has prompted calls to conserve ageing properties that symbolise the country's recent history and economic rise.

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: RPT-Fed's solo act faces tremors in Turkey and a slower Europe
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, deep into a cycle of rate hikes it hopes to continue into 2020, now faces emerging risks from abroad that could short-circuit its plans.

articles.author: Julie  Zhu
articles.title: UPDATE 2-China's Tianqi Lithium files for $1 bln Hong Kong listing - sources
articles.description: (Reuters/IFR) - China's Tianqi Lithium Corp  is looking to raise up to $1 billion in its Hong Kong stock market flotation, despite this year's fall in lithium prices, two people close to the deal told Reuters.

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche
articles.title: Norway wealth fund allowed to stay on as investor if Tesla goes private
articles.description: Rules governing Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund would allow it to stay on as an investor in Tesla if the electric carmaker goes private, its deputy CEO said on Tuesday.

articles.author: Abhinav Ramnarayan
articles.title: German yield curve near flattest in a year before Schatz auction
articles.description: The gap between short and long-dated German government bond yields was close to its narrowest in over a year before an auction of two-year debt on Tuesday, partly because of a similar but sharper move in U.S. Treasuries.

articles.author: Noel Randewich
articles.title: The bull that won't die: S&P 500 back at a record after months on ice
articles.description: After a seven-month stall, Wall Street's bull market looks back on track, thanks to Amazon.com , Alphabet and other high-flying technology and consumer discretionary companies.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: METALS-London copper ticks above $6,000 a tonne as dollar slips
articles.description:
Base metals prices rose in early
Asian trade on Tuesday, with London copper climbing back above
the $6,000 a tonne mark, as the dollar slipped and the market
awaited crunch U.S.-China trade talks in Washington.

    A weaker dollar makes metals cheaper for hoâ€¦

articles.author: By ALEX VEIGA
articles.title: US stocks climb as investors welcome solid company earnings
articles.description: U.S. stocks moved higher in early trading Tuesday as investors welcomed solid results from homebuilders, retailers and other companies. Technology stocks also rose, rebounding from a slide a day ea...

articles.author: Alexandra Gibbs
articles.title: US Treasury yields rise ahead of China-US talks, Jackson Hole summit
articles.description: U.S. government debt prices dipped into the red on Tuesday.

articles.author: Alexandra Gibbs
articles.title: US futures tick higher ahead of China-US talks, Jackson Hole summit
articles.description: U.S. stock index futures eked out slight gains ahead of Tuesday's open, as investors turn their attention to the political and central banking spheres.

articles.author: AP
articles.title: Trump to rescind Obama-era coal emissions standards
articles.description: The administration plans to roll back the Clean Power Plan that restricts greenhouse gas emissions from coal-fired power plants

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Senator demands answers from travel insurance industry
articles.description: Report from Ed Markey's office warns consumers might not get the protection they think they paid for
